title: Sans for 5pt print
content:
Hello.

Please can you recommend a sans-serif for small print (5 pt).  
The text will be a URL (i.e. no need for extended symbols, etc)  
If it is a freeware font would be perfect, but a commercial type is fine.

Thank you!
author: cuchosan

comments.content:
Amplitude:  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/amplitude/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100123040038/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/amplitude/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/amplitude/")

(maybe you can find other uses for it other than for just a URL)

<cite>If it is a freeware font would be perfect</cite>

perfection does have its price
I`m thinking of Union or Yanone Kaffeesatz. Although I'm worried about Yanone being condensed, give it a try. They are both free.

Note that Union is only free for “projects related with the Danish Ministry of Culture. For other uses, please contact M.R. Olsen” (see [this older thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20100123040038/http:/typophile.com/node/16126#comment-94423)).
